article: When high school started, Becky and I became best friends. We _ many interests and quickly became inseparable. When high school ended, we both cried _ we would attend different colleges. Our first term of university life was _ . Our telephone bill and e-mails were incredibly long. In the second term I found some new friends with whom I felt very _ and I could _ out my feelings. I was eager to share my new friends with Becky. When Becky finally visited me at my school, we were excited. _ , something unexpected happened when I _ her to my new friends. Her eyes grew dark and I could see the _ within them. My new friends tried to share their friendship, but Becky seemed _ to accept it. I didn't understand _ the people I love most couldn't love each other. Becky _ . I knew she was not happy. I thought long about _ happened. At last, I found the answer. Becky saw me with my new friends and _ that we no longer shared the same experiences. She saw all the fun I was having _ her and wished she could a part of it. I wrote a letter to Becky _ she's always my best friend. I told her everyone had many friends, who were indeed life's greatest _ . Becky wrote me back soon. She was in _ and felt sorry about what she had done. I think Becky and I both learn an important lesson from it. _ can influence our friendship and change the experiences we've shared. We are now walking on two different paths of _ . While new friends are special and exciting, old friends are always there, _ to share their heart and soul, no matter how far apart.
